class.name: Router
class.description:
Represents an IP routing domain instance.
It provides data plane isolation of routed traffic and control plane isolation of routing entities from other routing instances.
It allows for further fragmentation of the routing domain.
Dependencies: The maximum number of InterfaceIPv4 MO configured as loopback is 64.

validationRules.rule: <schema xmlns="http://purl.oclc.org/dsdl/schematron"> <pattern> <rule> <assert test='count(InterfaceIPv4[@loopback]) le 64'><value-of select="."/> Maximum number of InterfaceIPv4 configured as loopback is 64</assert> <assert test='count(../Router/InterfaceIPv4) le 256'><value-of select="."/> Maximum number of InterfaceIPv4 configured is 256</assert> <assert test='count(../Router/InterfaceIPv6) le 256'><value-of select="."/> Maximum number of InterfaceIPv6 configured is 256</assert> <assert test='count(../Router/RouteTableIPv4Static/Dst/NextHop) le 10000'><value-of select="."/>: Max number of NextHop MOs (10000 NextHops) under RouteTableIPv4Static exceeded.</assert> <assert test='count(../Router/RouteTableIPv6Static/Dst/NextHop) le 10000'><value-of select="."/>: Max number of NextHop MOs (10000 NextHops) under RouteTableIPv6Static exceeded.</assert> <assert test='count(../Router/DnsClient) le 1'><value-of select="."/> Maximum number of DnsClient configured is 1</assert> </rule> </pattern> </schema>

attribute.name: routerId
attribute.description: The value component of the RDN.

attribute.name: ttl
attribute.description:
Default value of Time-To-Live (TTL).
The default value inserted into the TTL field of the IPv4 header of datagrams, originated from this instance, whenever a TTL value is not supplied by the transport layer protocol.

attribute.name: userLabel
attribute.description: Label for free use.

attribute.name: hopLimit
attribute.description:
IPv6 default hop limit.
The default value is inserted into the Hop Limit field of the IPv6 header of datagrams originated at this entity whenever a Hop Limit value is not supplied by the transport layer protocol.

class.name: Host
class.description:
Representation of an IP domain for traffic termination.
Optional to support - Flag: if-feature L3HostHost

attribute.name: hostId
attribute.description: Value component of the RDN.

attribute.name: ttl
attribute.description:
Default TTL value.
The default value is inserted into the Time-To-Live (TTL) field of the IPv4 header of datagrams originated at this entity, whenever a TTL value is not supplied by the transport layer protocol.
Optional to support - Flag: if-feature L3HostTtl

attribute.name: userLabel
attribute.description:
Label for free use.
Optional to support - Flag: if-feature L3HostUserLabel

attribute.name: hopLimit
attribute.description:
IPv6 default hop limit.
The default value is inserted into the Hop Limit field of the IPv6 header of datagrams originated at this entity whenever a Hop Limit value is not supplied by the transport layer protocol.
Optional to support - Flag: if-feature L3HostHopLimit

class.name: InterfaceIPv4
class.description: IPv4-addressed termination point; interface on an IPv4 routing domain.

validationRules.rule: <schema xmlns="http://purl.oclc.org/dsdl/schematron"> <pattern> <rule> <assert test='not((@bfdStaticRoutes eq 1) and (count(@bfdProfile) eq 0))'><value-of select="."/> When bfdStaticRoutes is ENABLED, bfdProfile attribute shall refer to a valid BfdProfile MO</assert> <assert test='(@encapsulation and not(@loopback)) or (@loopback and not(@encapsulation))'><value-of select="."/> One of the attributes encapsulation and loopback must be set, but not both at the same time</assert> <assert test='not(@loopback and (@bfdStaticRoutes eq 1))'><value-of select="."/> When loopback is set, value of bfdStaticRoutes attribute must be DISABLED</assert> <assert test='not(@loopback and ((count(AddressIPv4) ge 1) and (count(AddressIPv4[matches(@address,".+/32")]) lt 1)))'><value-of select="."/> Prefix length of loopback address must be /32</assert> <assert test='not((@loopback and @aclIngress) or (@loopback and @aclEgress))'><value-of select="."/> LOOPBACK interface is not allowed in ACL association</assert> <assert test='not((@aclIngress and (count(@aclIngress/AclEntryIpv4) eq 0)) or (@aclEgress and (count(@aclEgress/AclEntryIpv4) eq 0)))'><value-of select="."/> EMPTY AclIpv4 is not allowed in ACL association</assert> <assert test='not((@aclIngress and (../@routerId ne @aclIngress/../@routerId)) or (@aclEgress and (../@routerId ne @aclEgress/../@routerId)))'><value-of select="."/> Only AclIpv4 MO within SAME Router is allowed in ACL association</assert> <assert test='not((@aclIngress and contains(@encapsulation,"IpsecTunnel=")) or (@aclEgress and contains(@encapsulation,"IpsecTunnel=")))'><value-of select="."/> Ipsec Inner Interface is not allowed in ACL association</assert> <assert test='not((@bfdProfile and matches(@bfdProfile,".*,Router=.*,BfdProfile=.*") and (../@routerId ne @bfdProfile/../@routerId)))'><value-of select="."/>: BfdProfile may not refer to a different Router</assert> <assert test='not(@loopback and @egressQosMarking)'><value-of select="."/> The attribute egressQosMarking cannot be configured on an IP Loopback interface</assert> <assert test='not(@egressQosMarking and contains(@encapsulation,"IpsecTunnel="))'><value-of select="."/> The attribute egressQosMarking cannot be configured on an IPsec Inner interface</assert> <assert test='not(contains(@encapsulation,"IpsecTunnel=") and ((count(AddressIPv4) ge 1) and (count(AddressIPv4[matches(@address,".+/32")]) lt 1))'><value-of select="."/> Prefix length of Ipsec Inner interface address must be /32</assert> </rule> </pattern> </schema>

attribute.name: mtu
attribute.description: The maximum transmission unit (MTU) for IPv4.
attribute.disturbances: Changing this attribute causes traffic disturbances.

attribute.name: interfaceIPv4Id
attribute.description: The value component of the RDN.

attribute.name: addrPrimary
attribute.description:
Reference to the primary IPv4 address.
When there is a single address on the interface, it auto-points to it.
Optional to support - Flag: if-feature Ipv4PrimaryAddr

attribute.name: bfdProfile
attribute.description: BFD parameters used for BFD sessions from this IP interface.
attribute.dependencies: When bfdStaticRoutes is ENABLED, bfdProfile must refer to a valid BfdProfile MO.

attribute.name: loopback
attribute.description: Specifies if the interface is an IP Loopback Interface.
attribute.dependencies: One of the attributes encapsulation and loopback must be set, but not both at the same time. Loopback cannot be set, if an ACL association exists, that is if aclEgress or aclIngress are set.The attribute egressQosMarking cannot be configured on an IP Loopback interface.
attribute.disturbances: Changing this attribute causes traffic disturbances.

attribute.name: arpTimeout
attribute.description:
Specifies the average time that an entry remains in the ARP cache.
An entry is a dynamically learned IP address and its corresponding MAC address. The entry is then either refreshed, if the entry is still needed, or removed, if the entry is not needed any more.

attribute.name: bfdStaticRoutes
attribute.description:
Enables/disables BFD monitoring of static routing nexthops on this interface.
bfdStaticRoutes works in conjunction with bfdProfile, so to enable BFD monitoring, bfdStaticRoutes must be ENABLED, and bfdProfile must be defined. When BFD monitoring is enabled, all static routing nexthops on subnets of this IP interface will be monitored, unless explicitly disabled on peer/nexthop.
attribute.disturbances: Changing this attribute causes traffic disturbances.
attribute.takesEffect: When changed, BFD sessions will be created or deleted accordingly.

attribute.name: aclEgress
attribute.description: A reference to an ACL MO applied in the egress direction. If this attribute is empty, no ACL MO filtering will take place in the egress direction.
attribute.dependencies: If this attribute is set, loopback cannot be set. The referenced AclIpv4 MO must have at least one AclEntryIpv4 as a child. Only AclIpv4 MOs within the same router are allowed in an ACL association. An IPsec Inner Interface is not allowed in an ACL association.

attribute.name: aclIngress
attribute.description: A reference to an ACL MO applied in the ingress direction. If this attribute is empty, no ACL MO filtering will take place in the ingress direction.
attribute.dependencies: If this attribute is set, loopback cannot be set.The referenced AclIpv4 MO must have at least one AclEntryIpv4 as a child. Only AclIpv4 MOs within the same router are allowed in an ACL association. An IPsec Inner Interface is not allowed in an ACL association.

attribute.name: pcpArp
attribute.description: Specifies the PCP value for ARP packets using this interface (affects only VLAN interfaces).

attribute.name: routesHoldDownTimer
attribute.description:
Specifies the holddown timer used for static and dynamic routes that use this interface.
If this attribute is set, a holddown timer is started when the conditions for a static route to become available have been fulfilled. When the holddown timer expires, the route becomes available.
Similarly, OSPFv2 uses this attribute to delay neighbor discovery on this interface (that is, until the interface is deemed reliably up) until routesHoldDownTimer has expired, counting from the time that the underlying L2 interface transitioned to an operational state of ENABLED.
If this attribute is empty, there is no hold-down timer for routes.
This attribute does NOT affect the operational state of the interface.

attribute.name: trustDSCP
attribute.description: Replaces queue systems in ingress directions for policing/remarking.

attribute.name: reservedBy
attribute.description: Contains a list of MO instances that reserve this MO instance.

attribute.name: egressQosMarking
attribute.description:
The DSCP to PCP map used for marking DSCP tagged packets with a PCP value. The packets marked are either host originated or routed into the QoS domain.
If empty, the DSCP values are mapped to PCP values according to the following:
pcp0 = 0 pcp1 (empty) pcp2 = 10,12,14 pcp3 = 18,20,22 pcp4 = 8,16,26,28 pcp5 = 34,36,38,46 pcp6 = 32,40,48 pcp7 = 51,54
attribute.dependencies: The attribute egressQosMarking cannot be configured on an IP Loopback interface. The attribute egressQosMarking cannot be configured on an IPsec Inner interface.

attribute.name: routingPolicy
attribute.description:
A Routing Policy used for Policy Based Routing.
The value is a reference to a Routing Policy.
If a reference is assigned, Policy Based Routing of incoming packets will be enabled.
attribute.dependencies: routingPolicy can only be set when encapsulation is set to EthernetPort, VlanPort or Bridge. The referred RoutingPolicyIPv4 MO instance must belong to the same Router MO instance.

attribute.name: encapsulation
attribute.description: Reference to the underlying encapsulation, which can be an EthernetPort MO or a VlanPort MO. For InterfaceIPv4, this attribute can also refer to a Bridge MO or an IpsecTunnel MO.
attribute.dependencies: A VlanPort MO and an InterfaceIPv4 MO or InterfaceIPv6 MO cannot refer to the same EthernetPort MO. Applicable for InterfaceIPv4: One of the attributes encapsulation and loopback must be set, but not both at the same time. Applicable for InterfaceIPv6: This attribute must be set. If InterfaceIPv4 and InterfaceIPv6 encapsulates the same VlanPort they must reside in the same router. If InterfaceIPv4 and InterfaceIPv6 encapsulates the same EthernetPort they must reside in the same router.
attribute.disturbances: Changing this attribute causes traffic disturbances.

attribute.name: userLabel
attribute.description: Label for free use.

attribute.name: operationalState
attribute.description: The operational state.

attribute.name: availabilityStatus
attribute.description: The availability status. It contains details about operationalState.

attribute.name: administrativeState
attribute.description:
Administrative state of the L3 interface.
When LOCKED, the connection to the L3 stack is disabled and no L3 packets are received, transmitted or routed through.
Optional to support - Flag: if-feature L3IfAdministrativeState

class.name: AddressIPv4
class.description: Assigned IPv4 address including information about the subnet it resides on.

attribute.name: addressIPv4Id
attribute.description: The value component of the RDN.

attribute.name: address
attribute.description: IPv4 decimal address + "/" + prefix length <0-32>.
attribute.disturbances: Changing this attribute causes traffic disturbances.

attribute.name: userLabel
attribute.description: Label for free use.

attribute.name: origin
attribute.description:
Specifies who provides this address; if not STATIC, the address field is read-only.
Optional to support - Flag: if-feature AddressIPv4Origin

attribute.name: reservedBy
attribute.description: Contains a list of MO instances that reserve this MO instance.

mim.author: EAB/FJP/TA UABERPE
mim.name: RtnL3InterfaceIPv6
mim.description: IPv6-addressed termination point; interface on an IPv6 routing domain.

class.name: InterfaceIPv6
class.description: IPv6-addressed termination point; interface on an IPv6 Routing Function.

validationRules.rule: <schema xmlns="http://purl.oclc.org/dsdl/schematron"> <pattern> <rule> <assert test='@encapsulation'><value-of select="."/> The attribute encapsulation must be set </assert> </rule> </pattern> </schema>

attribute.name: mtu
attribute.description: The maximum transmission unit (MTU) for IPv6.
attribute.disturbances: Changing this attribute causes traffic disturbances.

attribute.name: interfaceIPv6Id
attribute.description: Value component of the RDN.

attribute.name: neighborDiscoveryTimeout
attribute.description:
Timeout value for the neighbor entry.
Configures how long the remote IPv6 node is considered reachable after the reachability confirmation event has occurred. A value of zero means that entries are never cleared from the cache.

attribute.name: neighborSolicitationInterval
attribute.description: Interval between the retransmitted neighbor solicitation messages on an interface.

attribute.name: bfdProfile
attribute.description:
BFD profile used for BFD sessions running on the interface.
BFD is not enabled on the interface when it is null.
Optional to support - Flag: if-feature InterfaceIPv6BfdProfile

attribute.name: loopback
attribute.description:
Encapsulation option for loopback interface.
Dependencies: One of the attributes encapsulation and loopback must be set, but not both at the same time.
attribute.dependencies: <schema xmlns="http://purl.oclc.org/dsdl/schematron"> <pattern> <rule> <assert test='not (@loopback and @encapsulation)'> loopback and encapsulation are either-or configuration for IP interface.</assert> </rule> </pattern> </schema>

attribute.name: reservedBy
attribute.description: Contains a list of MO instances that reserve this MO instance.

attribute.name: routesHoldDownTimer
attribute.description:
Specifies the holddown timer used for static routes that use this interface.
When this attribute is set, a holddown timer is started when the conditions for a static route to become available have been fulfilled. When the holddown timer expires, the route becomes available.
When not set, there is no hold-down timer for routes.
This attribute does NOT affect the operational state of the interface.

attribute.name: egressQosMarking
attribute.description:
The DSCP to PCP map used for marking DSCP tagged packets with a PCP value. The packets marked are either host originated or routed into the QoS domain.
If empty, the DSCP values are mapped to PCP values according to the following:
pcp0 = 0 pcp1 (empty) pcp2 = 10,12,14 pcp3 = 18,20,22 pcp4 = 8,16,26,28 pcp5 = 34,36,38,46 pcp6 = 32,40,48 pcp7 = 51,54

attribute.name: dscpNdp
attribute.description: The Differentiated Services Code Point (DSCP) value for Neighbor Discovery Protocol (NDP).

attribute.name: aclEgress
attribute.description: A reference to an ACL MO applied in the egress direction. If this attribute is empty, no ACL MO filtering will take place in the egress direction.
attribute.dependencies:
This attribute can be set only when encapsulation refers to a VlanPort, an EthernetPort, or a Bridge MO.
The referenced AclIpv6 MO must have at least one AclEntryIpv6 as a child. Only AclIpv6 MOs within the same router are allowed in an ACL association.

attribute.name: aclIngress
attribute.description: A reference to an ACL MO applied in the ingress direction. If this attribute is empty, no ACL MO filtering will take place in the ingress direction.
attribute.dependencies:
This attribute can be set only when encapsulation refers to a VlanPort, an EthernetPort, or a Bridge MO.
The referenced AclIpv6 MO must have at least one AclEntryIpv6 as a child. Only AclIpv6 MOs within the same router are allowed in an ACL association.

attribute.name: encapsulation
attribute.description: Reference to the underlying encapsulation, which can be an EthernetPort MO or a VlanPort MO. For InterfaceIPv4, this attribute can also refer to a Bridge MO or an IpsecTunnel MO.
attribute.dependencies: A VlanPort MO and an InterfaceIPv4 MO or InterfaceIPv6 MO cannot refer to the same EthernetPort MO. Applicable for InterfaceIPv4: One of the attributes encapsulation and loopback must be set, but not both at the same time. Applicable for InterfaceIPv6: This attribute must be set. If InterfaceIPv4 and InterfaceIPv6 encapsulates the same VlanPort they must reside in the same router. If InterfaceIPv4 and InterfaceIPv6 encapsulates the same EthernetPort they must reside in the same router.
attribute.disturbances: Changing this attribute causes traffic disturbances.

attribute.name: userLabel
attribute.description: Label for free use.

attribute.name: operationalState
attribute.description: The operational state.

attribute.name: availabilityStatus
attribute.description: The availability status. It contains details about operationalState.

attribute.name: administrativeState
attribute.description:
Administrative state of the L3 interface.
When LOCKED, the connection to the L3 stack is disabled and no L3 packets are received, transmitted or routed through.
Optional to support - Flag: if-feature L3IfAdministrativeState

class.name: AddressIPv6
class.description: Assigned IPv6 address including information about the subnet it resides on.

attribute.name: origin
attribute.description: Specifies who provides this address; if not STATIC, the address field is read-only.

attribute.name: addressIPv6Id
attribute.description: The value component of the RDN.

attribute.name: address
attribute.description: IPv6 address + "/" + prefix length<0-128>.

attribute.name: userLabel
attribute.description: Label for free use.

attribute.name: reservedBy
attribute.description: Contains a list of MO instances that reserve this MO instance.

mim.author: EAB/FJP/TA UABERPE
mim.name: RtnIP_
mim.description:
Decision MOM for RtnIP.
Shall not be visible.

attribute.name: dnsClientId
attribute.description: The value component of the RDN.

attribute.name: serverAddress
attribute.description: Specifies a list of addresses of DNS servers.

attribute.name: dscp
attribute.description: The Differentiated Services Code Point (DSCP) value for DNS related IP packets. Only IP packets originated from the node are tagged with the DSCP value.

mim.author: EAB/FJP/TA UABERPE
mim.name: RtnL3Library
mim.description: Library for common L3 types, including abstract classes.

enum.name: Origin
enum.description: Possible origins of an assigned IP address.

enumMember.name: DHCP
enumMember.description: Source of the resource is DHCP.

enumMember.name: IKEV2
enumMember.description: Source of the resource is Internet Key Exchange (IKEv2).

enumMember.name: NDP
enumMember.description: Source of the resource is NDP.

enum.name: EnableDisable
enum.description: Type including ENABLE and DISABLE values.

derivedDataType.name: EthPCP
derivedDataType.description: Specifies the PCP value for ARP packets using this interface (does only effect VLAN-interfaces).

class.name: ManagedObject
class.description: The ManagedObject MO represents a generic MO type. It does not represent any real resource in the system and can therefore not be instanciated. It is used as a MO-reference that can refer to multiple MO types.

slot.name: description
slot.value: The total number of octets transmitted in IP multicast datagrams. Not applicable for an IP Loopback Interface, that is, if the attribute loopback is set. Specification: RFC 4293, section 5.

slot.name: description
slot.value: Ingress packets that got forwarded. Not applicable for an IP Loopback Interface, that is, if the attribute loopback is set.

slot.name: description
slot.value: The number of input IP datagrams discarded because the IP address in their IP header's source field was not a valid address to be received at this entity. Not applicable for an IP Loopback Interface, that is, if the attribute loopback is set.

slot.name: description
slot.value: The number of input IP datagrams that are discarded, because no route could be found to transmit them to their destination. Not applicable for an IP Loopback Interface, that is, if the attribute loopback is set. Specification: RFC 4293, section 5.

slot.name: description
slot.value: The number of locally-addressed IP datagrams received successfully but discarded because of an unknown or unsupported protocol. Not applicable for an IP Loopback Interface, that is, if the attribute loopback is set. Specification: RFC 4293, section 5.

slot.name: description
slot.value: The number of IP datagrams successfully reassembled. Specification: RFC 4293, section 5.

slot.name: description
slot.value: The number of IP datagrams that have been discarded because they needed to be fragmented but could not be. This includes IPv4 packets that have the DF bit set. Not applicable for an IP Loopback Interface, that is, if the attribute loopback is set. Specification: RFC 4293, section 5.

slot.name: description
slot.value: The number of IP multicast datagrams received. Not applicable for an IP Loopback Interface, that is, if the attribute loopback is set.

slot.name: description
slot.value: The number of input IP datagrams for which no problems were encountered to prevent their continued processing, but were discarded (e.g., for lack of buffer space). Not applicable for an IP Loopback Interface, that is, if the attribute loopback is set. Specification: RFC 4293, section 5.

slot.name: description
slot.value: The total number of octets in IP datagrams delivered to the lower layers for transmission. Not applicable for an IP Loopback Interface, that is, if the attribute loopback is set. Specification: RFC 4293, section 5.

slot.name: description
slot.value: The number of output datagram fragments that have been generated as a result of IP fragmentation. Not applicable for an IP Loopback Interface, that is, if the attribute loopback is set. Specification: RFC 4293, section 5.

slot.name: description
slot.value: The number of input datagrams for which this entity was not their final IP destination and for which this entity attempted to find a route to forward them to that final destination. Not applicable for an IP Loopback Interface, that is, if the attribute loopback is set. Specification: RFC 4293, section 5.

slot.name: description
slot.value: The number of IP fragments received that needed to be reassembled at this interface. Specification: RFC 4293, section 5.

slot.name: description
slot.value: The number of datagrams for which this entity was not their final IP destination and for which it was successful in finding a path to their final destination. Not applicable for an IP Loopback Interface, that is, if the attribute loopback is set. Specification: RFC 4293, section 5.

slot.name: description
slot.value: The number of input IP datagrams discarded due to errors in their IP headers, including version number mismatch, other format errors, hop count exceeded, errors discovered in processing their IP options, etc. Not applicable for an IP Loopback Interface, that is, if the attribute loopback is set. Specification: RFC 4293, section 5.

slot.name: description
slot.value: The total number of IP datagrams that local IP user-protocols (including ICMP) supplied to IP in requests for transmission. Not applicable for an IP Loopback Interface, that is, if the attribute loopback is set. Specification: RFC 4293, section 5.

slot.name: description
slot.value: The number of input IP datagrams discarded because the IP address in their IP header's destination field was not a valid address to be received at this entity. Not applicable for an IP Loopback Interface, that is, if the attribute loopback is set. Specification: RFC 4293, section 5.

slot.name: description
slot.value: The number of IP broadcast datagrams transmitted. Not applicable for an IP Loopback Interface, that is, if the attribute loopback is set.

slot.name: description
slot.value: The number of output IP datagrams for which no problem was encountered to prevent their transmission to their destination, but were discarded (e.g., for lack of buffer space). Not applicable for an IP Loopback Interface, that is, if the attribute loopback is set. Specification: RFC 4293, section 5.

slot.name: description
slot.value: The total number of datagrams successfully delivered to IP user-protocols (including ICMP). Not applicable for an IP Loopback Interface, that is, if the attribute loopback is set.

slot.name: description
slot.value: The total number of octets received in IP multicast datagrams. Not applicable for an IP Loopback Interface, that is, if the attribute loopback is set. Specification: RFC 4293, section 5.

slot.name: description
slot.value: The number of IP broadcast datagrams received. Not applicable for an IP Loopback Interface, that is, if the attribute loopback is set. Specification: RFC 4293, section 5.

slot.name: description
slot.value: The number of failures detected by the IP re-assembly algorithm. Specification: RFC 4293, section 5.

slot.name: description
slot.value: The total number of IP datagrams that local IP user-protocols (including ICMP) supplied to IP in requests for transmission. Not applicable for an IP Loopback Interface, that is, if the attribute loopback is set.

slot.name: description
slot.value: The number of IP multicast datagrams received. Not applicable for an IP Loopback Interface, that is, if the attribute loopback is set. Specification: RFC 4293, section 5.

slot.name: description
slot.value: The total number of input IP datagrams received, including those received in error. Not applicable for an IP Loopback Interface, that is, if the attribute loopback is set.

slot.name: description
slot.value: The total number of IP datagrams that this entity supplied to the lower layers for transmission. Not applicable for an IP Loopback Interface, that is, if the attribute loopback is set.

slot.name: description
slot.value: The number of packets that were forwarded to a null route. Not applicable for an IP Loopback Interface, that is, if the attribute loopback is set.

slot.name: description
slot.value: The number of IP broadcast datagrams transmitted. Not applicable for an IP Loopback Interface, that is, if the attribute loopback is set. Specification: RFC 4293, section 5.

slot.name: description
slot.value: The number of IP multicast datagrams transmitted. Not applicable for an IP Loopback Interface, that is, if the attribute loopback is set. Specification: RFC 4293, section 5.

slot.name: description
slot.value: The number of input IP datagrams discarded because the datagram frame didn't carry enough data. Not applicable for an IP Loopback Interface, that is, if the attribute loopback is set. Specification: RFC 4293, section 5.

slot.name: description
slot.value: The number of IP broadcast datagrams received. Not applicable for an IP Loopback Interface, that is, if the attribute loopback is set.

slot.name: description
slot.value: The total number of octets transmitted in IP multicast datagrams. Not applicable for an IP Loopback Interface, that is, if the attribute loopback is set.

slot.name: description
slot.value: The total number of octets received in input IP datagrams, including those received in error. Not applicable for an IP Loopback Interface, that is, if the attribute loopback is set.

slot.name: description
slot.value: The total number of octets received in input IP datagrams, including those received in error. Not applicable for an IP Loopback Interface, that is, if the attribute loopback is set. Specification: RFC 4293, section 5.

slot.name: description
slot.value: The total number of input IP datagrams received, including those received in error. Not applicable for an IP Loopback Interface, that is, if the attribute loopback is set. Specification: RFC 4293, section 5.

slot.name: description
slot.value: The number of IP datagrams that have been successfully fragmented. Not applicable for an IP Loopback Interface, that is, if the attribute loopback is set. Specification: RFC 4293, section 5.

slot.name: description
slot.value: The number of IP multicast datagrams transmitted. Not applicable for an IP Loopback Interface, that is, if the attribute loopback is set.

slot.name: description
slot.value: Egress packets that got forwarded. Not applicable for an IP Loopback Interface, that is, if the attribute loopback is set.

slot.name: description
slot.value: The number of IP datagrams that would require fragmentation in order to be transmitted. Not applicable for an IP Loopback Interface, that is, if the attribute loopback is set. Specification: RFC 4293, section 5.

slot.name: description
slot.value: The total number of octets in IP datagrams delivered to the lower layers for transmission. Not applicable for an IP Loopback Interface, that is, if the attribute loopback is set.

slot.name: description
slot.value: The total number of IP datagrams that this entity supplied to the lower layers for transmission. Not applicable for an IP Loopback Interface, that is, if the attribute loopback is set. Specification: RFC 4293, section 5.

slot.name: description
slot.value: The total number of octets received in IP multicast datagrams. Not applicable for an IP Loopback Interface, that is, if the attribute loopback is set.

slot.name: description
slot.value: The total number of datagrams successfully delivered to IP user-protocols (including ICMP). Specification: RFC 4293, section 5.

slot.name: description
slot.value: The number of input IP datagrams discarded because the IP address in their IP header's destination field was not a valid address to be received at this entity. Specification: RFC 4293, section 5.

slot.name: description
slot.value: The number of output datagram fragments that have been generated as a result of IP fragmentation. Specification: RFC 4293, section 5.

slot.name: description
slot.value: The number of IP datagrams that have been successfully fragmented. Specification: RFC 4293, section 5.

slot.name: description
slot.value: The number of IP datagrams that would require fragmentation in order to be transmitted. Specification: RFC 4293, section 5.

slot.name: description
slot.value: The total number of octets received in IP multicast datagrams. Specification: RFC 4293, section 5.

slot.name: description
slot.value: The number of input IP datagrams discarded because the IP address in their IP header's source field was not a valid address to be received at this entity.

slot.name: description
slot.value: The number of input datagrams for which this entity was not their final IP destination and for which this entity attempted to find a route to forward them to that final destination. Specification: RFC 4293, section 5.

slot.name: description
slot.value: The number of IP fragments received that needed to be reassembled at this interface. Specification: RFC 4293, section 5.

slot.name: description
slot.value: The number of input IP datagrams for which no problems were encountered to prevent their continued processing, but were discarded (e.g., for lack of buffer space). Specification: RFC 4293, section 5.

slot.name: description
slot.value: The number of IP multicast datagrams transmitted. Specification: RFC 4293, section 5.

slot.name: description
slot.value: The total number of IP datagrams that local IP user-protocols (including ICMP) supplied to IP in requests for transmission. Specification: RFC 4293, section 5.

slot.name: description
slot.value: The total number of input IP datagrams received, including those received in error. Specification: RFC 4293, section 5.

slot.name: description
slot.value: The number of IP multicast datagrams received. Specification: RFC 4293, section 5.

slot.name: description
slot.value: The total number of IP datagrams that this entity supplied to the lower layers for transmission. Specification: RFC 4293, section 5.

slot.name: description
slot.value: The number of IP datagrams that have been discarded because they needed to be fragmented but could not be. This includes IPv6 packets that are being forwarded and exceed the outgoing link MTU. Specification: RFC 4293, section 5.

slot.name: description
slot.value: The total number of octets received in input IP datagrams, including those received in error. Specification: RFC 4293, section 5.

slot.name: description
slot.value: The number of input IP datagrams that are discarded, because no route could be found to transmit them to their destination. Specification: RFC 4293, section 5.

slot.name: description
slot.value: The number of locally-addressed IP datagrams received successfully but discarded because of an unknown or unsupported protocol. Specification: RFC 4293, section 5.

slot.name: description
slot.value: The number of datagrams for which this entity was not their final IP destination and for which it was successful in finding a path to their final destination. Specification: RFC 4293, section 5.

slot.name: description
slot.value: The number of input IP datagrams discarded because the datagram frame did not carry enough data. Specification: RFC 4293, section 5.

slot.name: description
slot.value: The number of failures detected by the IP re-assembly algorithm. Specification: RFC 4293, section 5.

slot.name: description
slot.value: The total number of datagrams successfully delivered to IP user-protocols (including ICMP). Specification: RFC 4293, section 5.

slot.name: description
slot.value: The number of input IP datagrams discarded due to errors in their IP headers, including version number mismatch, other format errors, hop count exceeded, errors discovered in processing their IP options, etc. Specification: RFC 4293, section 5.

slot.name: description
slot.value: The number of output IP datagrams for which no problem was encountered to prevent their transmission to their destination, but were discarded (e.g., for lack of buffer space). Specification: RFC 4293, section 5.

slot.name: description
slot.value: The number of IP datagrams successfully reassembled. Specification: RFC 4293, section 5.

slot.name: description
slot.value: The number of packets that were forwarded to a null route.

slot.name: description
slot.value: The total number of octets in IP datagrams delivered to the lower layers for transmission. Specification: RFC 4293, section 5.

slot.name: description
slot.value: The total number of octets transmitted in IP multicast datagrams. Specification: RFC 4293, section 5.
